title: >>> Hitting the PAVEMENT
body_text:
For the second week in a row, dodgeball certainly saw its share of injuries. Faceshots and falls were just some of the many highlights witnessed at DODGEBALL 38. "Killed or be Killed", as the poster expresses, appeared to have fit the event perfectly. The "Records" portion of the results will lead off ...
The Records
> Attendance: 29
> Biggest Returns:
Suzanne Guarino (Last Played at DODGEBALL 20)
Ben Cotta (Last Played at DODGEBALL XXV)
Bill Plantz (Last Played at DODGEBALL 30)
> New Players: (3) Paul G, Adam K, Lucio B.
> Ocean Road Park hosted the event for the first time since DODGEBALL 35.
> A brand-new type of dodgeball game was tried out for the first time. "Captain Dodgeball" (can be re-named) was given its first go. Each team would select (sometimes in secret) and if the captain of that team was eliminated in anyway, the game was lost.
> Sara DeCuir, as the leading captain of her team, she went toe-to-toe with Joe Kelly in only the second inter-gender captains match in dodgeball history. Joe Kelly prior to DODGEBALL 38 had never once been captain, despite debuting at D-DAY VI and attending numerous events since. As for Sara, her previous go came at the first inter-gender captains match when she went against Ryan McCrorey at DODGEBALL X6.
> Although some could say it took away from the dodgeball games, several games of basketball were played during dodgeball matches by eliminated players.
Intensity vs. Intensity: Sara DeCuir vs. Joe Kelly
For only the second time in the incredible journey of dodgeball, an inter-gender captains battle headlined an event. As noted already, the first took place at the very first Wall High School event, DODGEBALL X6 back on December 3rd. Two of the most intense athletes ever squared off; Ryan McCrorey and Sara DeCuir.
Five months later at the start of the new month of May, Sara did it again, this time going head-to-head with intense and charismatic player, Joe Kelly. The record books are changed each and every week. What stats and facts would be the new additions?
Five to three: that statistic has been stamped into the record books, in favor of Joe. The match itself could go down as one of the most memorable of all-time, especially with the addition of a new game-type of "Captain Dodgeball". Both captains formed athletic teams, making for an exciting event.
Top Stars of DODGEBALL 38
A Message from John Tronolone:
"As witnessed at DODGEBALL 38, I took one hell of a spill in the first few minutes of the night. Normally I'd post info about standout players, but obviously due to what happened to me, I was't able to capture much of others' participation. A few things I do remember though was Bill Plantz not just hitting rim, but actually making it in the hoop. Lenny Herrera, who was standing in front of me, made what I thought was one of the sickest catches I've personally evey seen, done in mid-air. Steve Adams eliminated in all three of his brothers within one minute (And yes Chris, I know the story ((lol)).
As for me, and a few of you have expressed your concern, I'd be lying if I said I wasn't sore. My knees, [especially my right] are pretty banged up. My neck, elbows, and chin are also quite bruised. At the moment, my most painful injuries are without question my left hip and right wrist.
I've have always believed that if I didn't come home sore, bruised, etc. from a dodgeball event, then I wasn't playing my hardest. As for you Kevin Adams, who hit me in the shoulder less than a second prior to my fall, you will pay for you crime!"
DODGEBALL 39
DODGEBALL 39 is this coming Saturday, May 13th, starting at 6:30pm. As a result of 38's loss of dodge balls, it would be a smart move to head back to Wall High School for this event. For those unaware, Kevin Megill has already bought two new dodgeballs. His efforts as always are greatly appreciated.
DODGEBALL 40
There are only two weeks that seperate you, the dodgeball crew, from another milestone, "ten" event: DODGEBALL 40. DODGEBALL 40 will also take place at Wall High School, starting a half-hour earlier than the normal time, at 6pm. As it has been preached time and again, those who have yet to attend a "ten" event, they are considered to be favorites, especially among many veterans.
The theme song, facts and stats, and much more are in preparation. DODGEBALL 40 is Saturday, May 20th.
